answerText: Margaret Eleanor Atwood [10] This remarkably prolific short story author won the 2009 Man Booker International Prize for her entire body of work, which includes the collections Too Much Happiness, The Moons of Jupiter, and The Dance of the Happy Shades.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | MIT A  | 19 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Name these Canadian authors, for 10 points each. [10] Grace Marks is questioned about the murders of Thomas Kinnear and Nancy Montgomery in this author's novel Alias Grace. She described Offred's sexual servitude to the husband of Serena Joy in her book The Handmaid's Tale.
